Load libraries and import data

```{r setup-and-import}
library(tidyverse)
library(glue)

theme_set(theme_light())

polls <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2020/2020-04-14/polls.csv')
rankings <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2020/2020-04-14/rankings.csv')
```


Inspect data

```{r points-by-year}
rankings_golden_age <- rankings %>%
  group_by(year) %>%
  summarise(total_points = sum(points)) %>%
  mutate(golden_age = between(year, 1990, 1999))
  
rankings_golden_age %>%
  ggplot(aes(year, total_points, col = golden_age, group = 1)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_line(size = 0.5, alpha = 0.2) +
  annotate("rect", xmin = 1989.5, xmax = 1999.5, ymin = 0, ymax = 320, fill = "grey50", alpha = 0.1) +
  annotate("text", x = 2000, y = 280, hjust = 0, label = "Juicy (The Notorious B.I.G.)\nwas the top-scoring song of\n1994 (and overall)") +
  annotate("curve", x = 1999.8, xend = 1994.5, y = 300, yend = 310, curvature = 0.25, arrow = arrow(length = unit(2, "mm"))) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(1980, 2020, 5)) +
  labs(title = "The 90s was a golden age of rap",
       subtitle = "",
       caption = "Source: BBC Music",
       x = "",
       y = "") +
  theme(panel.grid = element_blank())
```

```{r top-1994-songs}
rankings %>%
  filter(year == 1994) %>%
  mutate(title = fct_reorder(glue("{title} ({artist})"), points)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(points, title, fill = artist)) +
  geom_col() +
  labs(title = "Is The Notorious B.I.G. the G.O.A.T. of rap?",
       subtitle = "Songs from 1994, the highest-scoring year among critics",
       caption = "Source: BBC Music") +
  theme(legend.position = "none")
```

```{r}
rankings %>%
  count(artist, wt = points, sort = TRUE)
```
